schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.summary: A brief descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.name: UserSummary

schema.description: Specifies an OAuth provider settings configuration that defines the type of the provider and the authorization details about the provider.
schema.name: OAuthProvider
OAuthFlow

type.summary: Defines different types of OAuth flows. You create an OAuth security definition of a specific type according to the required OAuth grant type. Each of the flows corresponds to an OAuth grant type.

value.summary: The Implicit flow corresponds to the implicit OAuth grant type.
value.name: implicit
value.description: In the implicit flow, the client receives the access token directly from the resource owner.

value.summary: The Password flow corresponds to the OAuth grant type of Resource Owner Password Credentials.
value.name: password
value.description: In the resource owner password credentials flow, the client uses password credentials of the resource owner to obtain authorization.

value.summary: The Application flow corresponds to the Client Credentials OAuth grant type.
value.name: application
value.description: In the client credentials flow, the client uses its own credentials to obtain authorization.

value.summary: The Access code flow corresponds to the Authorization Code OAuth grant type.
value.name: accessCode
value.description: In the authorization code flow, the client directs the resource owner to an intermediary authorization server. The server issues access token to the client after authenticating the client.

type.name: dmAPISecurityOAuthFlow

schema.description: Specifies the OAuth flow to enforce to protect the target. The value should be among the supported grant types that are defined by the referenced OAuth provider.

<p>Specifies the scopes that the access token is valid to access. To specify multiple scopes, use a space between each scope. The order of scopes does not matter.</p><ul><li>The allowed scopes for this configuration must be a subset of the allowed scopes set for the API OAuth security definition.</li><li>The allowed scopes for the API OAuth security definition must be a subset of the allowed scopes set for the OAuth provider settings.</li></ul><p>Scopes ensure that the granted access token is valid to access only specific protected resources.</p>
schema.summary: The scopes that the access token is valid to access
schema.name: OAuthScope

schema.description: When specified the URL that overrides the advanced scope URL in the OAuth provider settings. The value must be a properly formatted URL.
schema.summary: The URL that overrides the advanced scope URL in the OAuth provider settings
schema.name: OAuthAdvScopeURL

schema.description: When the OAuth advanced scope URL uses the HTTPS protocol, specifies the TLS client profile to secure the connection.
schema.summary: TLS client profile to secure the HTTPS connection to the OAuth advanced scope URL
schema.name: OAuthAdvScopeTLSProfile
